name: Round Robin Demo
description: Demonstration of round-robin sampling preventing machine gun effect on rapid repeats

performance.notes: Demonstration of round-robin sampling. Same note repeated 16 times at same velocity. Round-robin count is 16, so each repeat plays a different sample variation. This prevents 'machine gun effect' where the same sample repeats identically. Creates human feel with natural variation.
performance.technique: Enable round-robin for percussive instruments. Set round-robin count to number of variations. Sam automatically cycles through samples. Creates human feel. Essential for drums, percussion, shakers, tambourines.
performance.roundRobinExplanation: Without round-robin: Same sample repeats = machine gun effect. With round-robin: Alternating samples = natural variation. The more variations, the more natural.
performance.tip: Use round-robin count of 4-8 for hi-hats. Use 8-16 for shakers and tambourines. Use 2-4 for snares and kicks.
